thread.title: Two men arrested over fatal hit-and-run crash in Ayr
thread.title_full: Two men arrested over fatal hit-and-run crash in Ayr

title: Two men arrested over fatal hit-and-run crash in Ayr

organizations.name: ayr image copyright police scotland image

text:
Image copyright Police Scotland Image caption Joan Price died in the crash Two men aged 17 and 18 have been arrested following a fatal hit-and-run crash in South Ayrshire. 
Joan Price, 59, from Troon, died and another woman was seriously hurt in the crash on the A77 near Ayr on Monday. 
Police believe the driver and passenger of a second vehicle involved in the collision left the scene near the Holmston roundabout in another car. 
Inquiries are continuing to trace two other men in connection with the incident. 
The arrested teenagers are expected to appear Ayr Sheriff Court on Wednesday. Image caption The crash happened on the A77 near the Holmston roundabout at Ayr 
Ms Price was driving her red Nissan Pulsar northbound on the A77 when it was involved in the crash at around 21:35. 
She died at the scene, while her 39-year-old female passenger was taken to Ayr Hospital with serious injuries. She was said to be in a stable condition. 
Police said the black Volkswagen Golf also involved was "undriveable" following the crash. 
Its driver and passenger were believed to have left the scene in a silver Audi A3 which was on the A77 at the same time. 
Tributes have been paid to Ms Price, who was a member of the Dunaskin Doon brass band. 'Beautiful soul' 
A post on the band's facebook page said: "The Dunaskin family are heartbroken and devastated to hear of the passing of our dear friend and fellow band member, Joan Price, following a car accident last night. 
"Joan was a beautiful soul, inside and out, who always had a kind word and a cheerful smile for everyone. 
"The band send their deepest condolences to Joan's family as they begin to try and come to terms with their loss." 
Former colleagues in the Kilmarnock Concert Band said: "We are shocked and saddened by the news of the tragic death of a past band member, Joan Price, last night in a road traffic accident, along with another past band member, Gillian, who is currently in hospital. 
"The band send their condolences to Colin and the family, and hope that Gillian makes a speedy recovery."
